intro: Cynoglossum incanum, commonly known as hoary stock, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Cynoglossum incanum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
